metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14901 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A heap overflow flaw was found in the Linux kernel, all versions 3.x.x and4.x.x before 4.18.0, in Marvell WiFi chip driver. The vulnerability allowsa remote attacker to cause a system crash, resulting in a denial ofservice, or execute arbitrary code. The highest threat with thisvulnerability is with the availability of the system. If code executionoccurs, the code will run with the permissions of root. This will affectboth confidentiality and integrity of files on the system.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
